name: No-Knead Skillet Olive Bread
author: Mitch Hendricks
summary: No-knead skillet olive bread is a very easy to make, no-knead, crusty, and delicious bread packed with marinated olives and garlic.
ingredients: 2 cups lukewarm water (105 degrees F, 40 degrees C)
1 cup marinated olives (such as Star® Garlic & Basil) - drained, chopped, and herbs and garlic reserved
1 teaspoon dried parsley, or as needed
directions: Combine water and yeast in a large mixing bowl
Add 1 cup flour and 1/2 tablespoon salt
Stir using a wooden spoon until combined
Stir in olives, reserved herbs and garlic, and garlic powder
Add remaining flour 1 cup at a time, stirring until thoroughly combined
Cover bowl with plastic wrap and set in a warm spot to rise for 1 hour
Add 1 tablespoon oil to an 8-inch cast iron skillet and spread to coat bottom and sides
Remove plastic wrap from bowl and transfer dough to the prepared skillet and shape into a disc
Cover with a kitchen towel and let stand for 30 minutes
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Drizzle remaining oil on top of the loaf and sprinkle with salt and parsley
Score the top of the loaf with a knife
Bake in the preheated oven until the top is nicely browned, 30 to 35 minutes
Remove bread from oven and turn on to a wire rack to cool before serving, about 20 minutes
